gurmukhi: dyK Ajwieb Kwn dSw qb gYrq KwN mn ros BrXo ] su Dvwie kY sXMdn jwie prXo Ar bIr hUM qy nhI nYk frXo ]
transliteration: Dekh Ajaaib Khaan Dashaa Tab Gadrat Khaan Man Ros Bdaryo|| Su Ahavaae Kai Syandan Jaae Daryo Ar Beer Hoon Te Nahinaik Daryo||
translation: Seeing such a condition of Ajaib Khan, the mind of Ghairat Khan was filled with rage; he caused his chariot to be driven and fearlessly fell upon the enemy;

gurmukhi: As pwn Dry rn bIc duhUM iqh Awps mY bhu ju`Du krXo ] mn XO aupjI aupmw bn mY gj so md ko gj Awn ArXo ]1151]
transliteration: As Paan Ddare Ran Beech Duhoon Tih Aapas Mai Bahu Juddh(u) Daryo|| Man Yooun Oupjioupmaa Ban Mai Gad So Mad Ko Gad Aandaryo||1151||
translation: Both the mighty warriors fought a dreadful battle taking swords in their hands; they looked like tow elephants fighting with each other in the forest.1151.

gurmukhi: gYrq KwN brCI gih kY br so Air bIr kI Er clweI ] Awvq ib`jl qw sm dyK kY kwit kiRpwn so BUm igrweI ]
transliteration: Gadrat Khaan Barchhigadh Kai Bar So Ar(i) Beer Kior Chadhaaee|| Oovat Bijjal Taa Sam Dekh Kai Kaattee Kridaan So Bhoom Giraaee||
translation: Holding his lance in his hand, Ghairat Khan threw it on the enemy which was intercepted and thrown on the ground by Anag Singh with his sword, moving like lightning;

gurmukhi: so n lgI irs kY irp ko brCI gih dUsrI Er clweI ] XoN aupmw aupjI ijX mY mwno CUt clI nB qy ju hvweI ]1152]
transliteration: So Na Lagiris Kai Rip Ko Barchhigadh Doosarior Chadhaaee|| Yon Oupmaa Oupjijiya Mai Maano Chhodht Chalinabh Te Ju Havaaee||1152||
translation: That lance did not strike the enemy, but he discharged a second lance like an aerial bomb shot in the sky.1152.

gurmukhi: dUsrI dyKkY swNg blI niRp Awvq kwit kY BUm igrweI ] lY brCI ApnI kr mY niRp gYrq KwN pr kop clweI ]
transliteration: Doosridekh-kai Saan Balinrip Aavat Kaattee Kai Bhoom Giraaee|| Lai Barchhiapnidar Mai Nrip Gadrat Khaan Par Kop Chadhaaee||
translation: The second lance was also intercepted and thrown on the ground by the king and threw his lance in great fury on Ghairat Khan,

gurmukhi: lwg geI iqhky muK mY bih sRaun clXo aupmw ThrweI ] kop kI Awg mhwN biFkY fF kY ihX kau mno bwhir AweI ]1153]
transliteration: Laag Gadtihke Moukh Mai Bah(i) Sraoun Chadyo Oupmaa Thahraaee|| Kop Kiaag Mahaan Badh(i)kai Hiya Kau Mano Baahar(i) Aaee||1153||
translation: Which hit him on his face; the blood gushed out like the fire of anger moving out of the heart.1153.

gurmukhi: imrqk huie DrnI prXo joiq rhI Thrwie ] jnu AkwS qy Bws kir pXo rwh fir Awie ]1154]
transliteration: Mirtak Hue Dharnidaryo Jot(i) Rahithahraae|| Jan(u) Akaadh Te Bhaas Kar(i) Payo Raah Dar(i) Aae||1154||
translation: He died and fell on the ground and his consciousness ended; he appeared like the sun coming down from the sky on the earth out of fear.1154.

gurmukhi: kop Bry rn mY kib sXwm qbY hirjU ieh BwNiq kihXo hY ] ju`D ibKY Btu kaun gnY liKbIr hnY mn mY ju cihXo hY ]
transliteration: Kop Bhare Ran Mai Kabi Syaam Tabai Har(i)ju Eh Bhaant(i) Kahiyo Hai|| Juddh Bikhai Bhat(u) Kaoun Gadai Lakh(i)beer Hanai Man Mai Ju Chahiyo Hai||
translation: Then Krishna said this in rage, “Who is this heroic fighter who has killed all the warriors and thrown them on the ground according to his heart’s desire?

gurmukhi: jwnq hau iqh qRws qumY iknhUM kr mY DnhUM n gihXo hY ] qw qy pDwrhu Dwmn ko su lKXo qum qy purK`q rihXo hY ]1155]
transliteration: Jaanat Hau Tih Traas Toumai Kinhoon Kar Mai Dhanhoon Na Gadiyo Hai|| Taa Te Paddaroh Dhaamanndko Su Lakhyo Toum Te Purkhatt Rahiyo Hai||1155||
translation: “I know that fearing him, you are not catching your bows and arrows in your hands; in my opinion you may all go to your homes, because your audacity seems to have ended.”1155.
